```{r calculate median 80q0 in over time}
median_q <- lst()
for (s in c("male", "female")) {
  median_q[[s]] <- apply(
    X = cause_q[[s]],
    MARGIN = c(1, 2, 4),
    FUN = median
  ) |>
    as.data.frame.table(stringsAsFactors = FALSE) |>
    as_tibble() |>
    rename(`80q0` = Freq) |>
    mutate(year = as.integer(year)) |>
    arrange()
}
```

```{r calculate median 80q0 relative change 2002-2019}
median_q_rel_change <- lst()
for (s in c("male", "female")) {
  median_q_rel_change[[s]] <- apply(
    X = (cause_q[[s]]["2019", , , ] - cause_q[[s]]["2002", , , ]) / cause_q[[s]]["2002", , , ],
    MARGIN = c(1, 3),
    FUN = median
  ) |>
    as.data.frame.table(stringsAsFactors = FALSE) |>
    as_tibble() |>
    rename(d80q0 = Freq)
}
```

Relative changes:

```{r percentage relative changes}
s <- "male"
apply(
  X = (cause_q[[s]]["2019", , , ] - cause_q[[s]]["2002", , , ]) * 100 / cause_q[[s]]["2002", , , ],
  MARGIN = c(1, 3),
  FUN = quantile,
  p = c(0.025, 0.5, 0.975)
) |>
  as.data.frame.table(stringsAsFactors = FALSE) |>
  as_tibble() |>
  rename(quantile = Var1, `rel_change` = Freq) |>
  arrange() |>
  pivot_wider(names_from = quantile, values_from = `rel_change`) |>
  filter(cause == "All cancers") |>
  arrange(-`50%`)
```

## maps

Maps of 80q0 in 2019 and d80q0 2002-19.
```{r map 80q0}
for (s in c("female", "male")) {
  for (disease in cause_list[[s]]) {
    print(disease)
    map <- shape |>
      left_join(
        median_q |>
          pluck(s) |>
          filter(year == 2019) |>
          filter(cause == disease) |>
          mutate(LAD2020 = LAD)
      ) |>
      ggplot(aes(fill = `80q0`)) +
      geom_sf(colour = "white", linewidth = 0.01) +
      scale_fill_continuous_sequential(
        palette = "Reds",
        name = ""
      ) +
      theme_void() +
      theme(legend.position = "none")

    p <- median_q |>
      pluck(s) |>
      filter(year == 2019) |>
      filter(cause == disease) |>
      ggplot(aes(x = `80q0`, y = 1, fill = after_stat(x))) +
      geom_density_ridges_gradient(colour = "#cccccc", size = 0.1) +
      scale_fill_continuous_sequential(
        palette = "Reds",
        name = str_c("Probability of dying for \n", disease),
        n.breaks = 5
      ) +
      scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +
      theme_void() +
      theme(
        legend.direction = "horizontal",
        legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.key.width = unit(9, units = "pt"),
        legend.key.height = unit(3, units = "pt"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 3),
        legend.title = element_text(
          size = 3,
          face = "bold"
        )
      ) +
      guides(
        fill = guide_colorbar(
          title.position = "bottom",
          title.hjust = 0
        )
      )

    range_change <- median_q_rel_change |>
      pluck(s) |>
      filter(cause == disease) |>
      pull(d80q0) |>
      range() |>
      sign() |>
      sum()

    if (range_change == 0) {
      change_mp <- 0
    } else if (range_change < 0) {
      change_mp <- median_q_rel_change |>
        pluck(s) |>
        filter(cause == disease) |>
        pull(d80q0) |>
        max()
    } else {
      change_mp <- median_q_rel_change |>
        pluck(s) |>
        filter(cause == disease) |>
        pull(d80q0) |>
        min()
    }

    map_change <- shape |>
      left_join(
        median_q_rel_change |>
          pluck(s) |>
          filter(cause == disease) |>
          mutate(LAD2020 = LAD)
      ) |>
      ggplot(aes(fill = `d80q0`)) +
      geom_sf(colour = "white", linewidth = 0.01) +
      scale_fill_continuous_divergingx(
        palette = "Geyser",
        mid = change_mp,
        name = "",
        labels = percent
      ) +
      theme_void() +
      theme(legend.position = "none")

    p_change <- median_q_rel_change |>
      pluck(s) |>
      filter(cause == disease) |>
      ggplot(aes(x = `d80q0`, y = 1, fill = after_stat(x))) +
      geom_density_ridges_gradient(colour = "#cccccc", size = 0.1) +
      scale_fill_continuous_divergingx(
        palette = "Geyser",
        mid = change_mp,
        name = str_c("Change in probability for \n", disease),
        labels = percent,
        n.breaks = 4
      ) +
      scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +
      theme_void() +
      theme(
        legend.direction = "horizontal",
        legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.key.width = unit(9, units = "pt"),
        legend.key.height = unit(3, units = "pt"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 3),
        legend.title = element_text(
          size = 3,
          face = "bold"
        )
      ) +
      guides(
        fill = guide_colorbar(
          title.position = "bottom",
          title.hjust = 0
        )
      )

    grid <- plot_grid(map, map_change)

    grid <- ggdraw(grid) +
      draw_plot(p, -0.35, -0.15, scale = 0.11) +
      draw_plot(p_change, 0.15, -0.15, scale = 0.11)

    save_plot(
      here(
        "thesis_analysis",
        "cancers",
        # "figures",
        str_c(s, "_map_", str_replace_all(disease, " ", "_"), ".pdf")
      ),
      grid
    )
  }
}
```

## pair plots

Pair plot of 80q0 in 2019
```{r 80q0 correlation plot}
pair_skeleton <- list(
  scale_fill_continuous_divergingx(
    palette = "BrBG",
    rev = TRUE,
    mid = 0,
    limits = c(-1, 1),
    name = "Correlation"
  ),
  guides(
    fill = guide_colorbar(
      title.position = "top",
      title.hjust = 0
    )
  ),
  theme_thesis(),
  theme(
    axis.line = element_blank(),
    legend.direction = "horizontal",
    legend.key.width = unit(15, units = "pt"),
    legend.key.height = unit(5, units = "pt"),
    legend.text = element_text(size = 5),
    legend.title = element_text(
      size = 5,
      face = "bold"
    )
  )
)

p_female <- median_q |>
  pluck("female") |>
  filter(year == 2019) |>
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = c(LAD),
    names_from = cause,
    values_from = `80q0`
  ) |>
  select(all_of(cause_list[["female"]])) |>
  select(-`All cancers`) |>
  ggcorr(size = 0) +
  pair_skeleton +
  geom_text(
    data = tibble(
      x = seq(cause_list[["female"]][-12]),
      y = seq(cause_list[["female"]][-12]),
      lbs = cause_list[["female"]][-12]
    ),
    aes(x, y, label = str_wrap(lbs, 12)),
    nudge_x = -0.5,
    hjust = 0,
    size = 1.5
  ) +
  labs(caption = paste("Probability of dying between birth and 80 in 2019,", "women"))

p_male <- median_q |>
  pluck("male") |>
  filter(year == 2019) |>
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = c(LAD),
    names_from = cause,
    values_from = `80q0`
  ) |>
  select(all_of(cause_list[["male"]])) |>
  select(-`All cancers`) |>
  ggcorr(size = 0) +
  pair_skeleton +
  geom_text(
    data = tibble(
      x = seq(cause_list[["male"]][-12]),
      y = seq(cause_list[["male"]][-12]),
      lbs = cause_list[["male"]][-12]
    ),
    aes(x, y, label = str_wrap(lbs, 12)),
    nudge_x = -0.5,
    hjust = 0,
    size = 1.5
  ) +
  labs(caption = paste("Probability of dying between birth and 80 in 2019,", "men")) +
  theme(legend.position = "none")

grid <- plot_grid(p_female + theme(legend.position = "none"), p_male)
grid <- plot_grid(get_legend(p_female), grid, ncol = 1, rel_heights = c(.1, 1))

save_plot(
  here(
    "thesis_analysis",
    "cancers",
    "figures",
    "correlation.pdf"
  ),
  grid
)
```

## poverty

```{r plot IMD}
for (s in c("female", "male")) {
  p <- median_q |>
    pluck(s) |>
    filter(year == 2019) |>
    mutate(LAD2020 = LAD) |>
    left_join(imd |> select(LAD2020, `income rank`)) |>
    left_join(lookup) |>
    ggplot(
      aes(
        x = `income rank`,
        y = `80q0`,
        colour = factor(GOR2011NM, levels = regions)
      )
    ) +
    geom_point(size = 0.1) +
    facet_wrap(
      ~ factor(cause, levels = cause_list[[s]]),
      scales = "free_y",
      labeller = label_wrap_gen(20)
    ) +
    labs(
      x = "Income deprivation rank",
      y = "Probability of dying between birth and 80 in 2019"
    ) +
    scale_colour_manual(values = region_col, name = "") +
    scale_x_continuous(
      breaks = c(n_lad / 7, 6 * n_lad / 7),
      labels = c("Least deprived", "Most deprived")
    ) +
    theme_thesis() +
    theme(
      legend.key.size = unit(0.01, "npc"),
      panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
      panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
      axis.ticks.x = element_blank()
    )

  save_plot(
    here(
      "thesis_analysis",
      "cancers",
      "figures",
      str_c(s, "_IMD", ".pdf")
    ),
    p
  )
}
```

Correlation of each cancer with poverty:

```{r correlation with poverty}
median_q |>
  bind_rows(.id = "sex") |>
  filter(year == 2019) |>
  mutate(LAD2020 = LAD) |>
  left_join(imd |> select(LAD2020, `income rank`)) |>
  group_by(sex, cause) |>
  summarise(correlation = cor(`80q0`, `income rank`, method = "spearman"))
```

## distribution

```{r calculate quantiles 80q0 in 2002 and 2019}
quantile_q <- lst()
for (s in c("male", "female")) {
  quantile_q[[s]] <- apply(
    X = cause_q[[s]][c("2002", "2019"), , , ],
    MARGIN = c(1, 2, 4),
    FUN = quantile,
    p = c(0.025, 0.5, 0.975)
  ) |>
    as.data.frame.table(stringsAsFactors = FALSE) |>
    as_tibble() |>
    rename(quantile = Var1, `80q0` = Freq) |>
    arrange() |>
    pivot_wider(names_from = quantile, values_from = `80q0`) |>
    group_by(year, cause) |>
    mutate(rank = rank(`50%`)) |>
    ungroup()
}
```

Range of probability of death:
```{r probability of death range}
quantile_q |>
  bind_rows(.id = "sex") |>
  mutate(LAD2020 = LAD) |>
  left_join(lookup) |>
  filter(year == 2019) |>
  filter(sex == "male") |>
  filter(cause == "All cancers") |>
  arrange(-`50%`) |>
  select(-c(LAD, LAD2020, GOR2011, cause))
```

Inequality of probability of death:
```{r inequality probability of death}
quantile_q |>
  pluck("male") |>
  mutate(LAD2020 = LAD) |>
  left_join(lookup) |>
  filter(year == 2019) |>
  group_by(cause) |>
  summarise(
    max_min = max(`50%`) / min(`50%`),
    q90_q10 = quantile(`50%`, 0.9) / quantile(`50%`, 0.1)
  )
```

